page.title: 01A GENERAL PICTURE
page.content: The D-BLOCK is situated about ten miles north of Norwich between the B 1354 and the B 1150.{Buxton}is the largest parish in the D-BLOCK and there are three other parishes within the area; viz:{Oxnead, Lammas with {Little Hautbois}and{Scottow. } The area can be split into four main groups.{(1)}The villages of Buxton and Lammas,{(2)}The surrounding farmland,{(3)}The River Bure and{(4)} the{airfield}of R.A.F Coltishall. Generally speaking the area consists of fairly flat land which is cut by the wide, shallow valley of the{River {Bure}which runs NW to SE across the D-BLOCK. Most of the land is{arable farmland } dotted with small woods and plantations.
